counsell excelleth farre take away many sinnes bring one offence righteousnesse consists many good act christ doth excellent one sinneful act adam transgression tim made sinner condemned adam offence iustified saued christ therefore adam sinne exceeds grace christ silas power force christ righteousnesse aboue adam offence respect number person worthinesse number effect also worthy righteousnes grace christ first blotteth adam sinne others touching guilt secondly breaketh strength rage sinne thirdly reformeth heart new obedience giueth interest perfect glory tim number may truely saide sence many saued christ perished adam silas seeme may sense onely infant dye infancy perish original sinne onely elect men perish perish impenitency continuance actuall sinnes onely birthsinne whereas saued whether infant men saued grace christ onely adde herevnto touching perish christmille mundis red mendis sufficit christus sufficient saue diuines affirme god saue therefore grace hath effect ordained sithence nayled christ crosse secondly must labour feele vertue christ crucified mortifying sinne wee may assure selues benefit christ crucified forgiuenesse sin lastly christ gaue himselfe wholly crosse sake ought wee striue euery sin bearing nourishing one sin keeping vnder one well another seeing christ spared none member part body euery one payned sinnes euen head foot tim doth word body sin signifie sylas whole man body soule borne parent come world corrupted sin albeit body alone whole man minde affection bee infected sin yet good reason doeth apostle liken sinne body calling body sin sin body first teach v sin thing subsisting force v secondly hath innumerable lust many member annexed thirdly though sin bee seated soule yet desire sin executed member body instrument lastly sinne conuayed soule first meanes body tim destroy body sin sylas quite abolish take nature thing performed time life still certainly shal perfected end life therefore said destroyed already done end marke christ aymes worke sanctification stil striue toward thogh cannot attaine liue hauing sin still abiding dwelling v howbeit spirit sanctification farre preuaileth sinnes cannot rule v make v henceforth serue sin wont doe sanctification tim declare vnto v serue sin sylas willingly sinne would haue done men doe freely readily execute member body sin desireth lusteth side seruing sinne motion desire sin obeyed either wil worke cast thought word deedes much may tim difference betweene hauing sin seruing sin silas betweene hauing naughty seruant suffering rule family euery godly man first bondage bodye onely seruice sinne whole man bodye soule secondly bondage egypt serued men heere bondage seruice done sinne satan vile lord commaund base silthy workes thirdly bondage egypt harme temporall losse libertie smart paine body seruice sinne losse eternall euen destruction hell euer without infinite mercy god fourthly bondage vnder pharaoh sence thraldome desired liberty seruice sinne men much suspect themselues bee bound thinke themselues free despise liberty lastly al outward bodage bond help themselues running away entreaty ransom bondage lie stil bound hand foote til god seruants new lord wit christ iesus redeemer tim shewe v meanes conuersion vvas wrought2 part sil doctrine gospell respect scripture called arme god esay immortall seede pet sauour life cor power god saluation rom forme mould text fitly mould forme vseth leaue behinde print image selfe hath vpon thing put vpon doth gospell altereth mind heart men maketh lke selfe say ful heauenly wisedome holinesse heerein consists difference betweene doctrine lawe doctrine gospell doctrine lawe forbiddeth v euill commandeth v good putteth strength v forbeare one doe therefore called ministery letter whereas doctrine gospell teacheth v faith loue hope repentance patience c withall imprinteth selfesame grace v giuing v power would haue v therefore tearmed ministery spirit righteousnesse cor tim learne sayd deliuered forme silas two thing first conuersion freedome sinne selues nothing towards suffer god worke vpon v waxe ornon agimus sed agimur sumus mere passiui clay receiueth print seale mould themselues nothing suffering impression seale mould secondly haue continuall neede haue stamp heauenly doctrine put vpon soules image forme godlinesse wee haue doctrine receiues continuall decay owne negligence sathans mallice hence apostle speaking godly romaine sayeth present time deliuered teach worke sanctification worke day yeare perfected one two sermon till death come tim may put v mind doctrine gospell effectual instrument begin perfect deliuerance sin sylas serues surre vp great loue vnto doctrine gospel seeing mean conuersion secondly shews great efficacy doctrin whe god pleased worke pull heartes sinne knit vnto god make v like vnto god beare image sathan thirdly wee ought haue bring doctrine reuerence loue acknowledging hauing singular reputation worke sake thess foot euen basest foulest part ought beautifull vnto v rom estate bee end hate rise vp leu despising prophesy tim manner obedience gospell vseth worke sylas heart say voluntary vnfaigned compulsory hypocriticallyin word outward shew serue god enough like tim speciall marke whereby try truth owne conuersion finde wee willingly good vprightnesse apply selues doe thing commaded word contrary lustes eschue euill heart law commaunds euer hath respect vnto gaine credit pleasure pain god godly though hee sin yet heart loues law hauing resisteth hateth sin secondly hence haue special comfort vnto al consent law god whose inward man delighteth whose minde serueth surely regenerate though haue many fearefull imperfection sinnes yet trueth allow law condemning sinnes doe allowing thing doe law willeth repeting hart ofte violate law weaknes certain mark new born child god sheweth fearful case ignorant god law either cannot care know consent law know therefore yet estate damnation therefore needfull thing together preaching gospel haue law soundly interpreted applyed men cannot consent gospell without preaching gospell power god write heart cannot much know law without preaching law paul confirmes doctrine free righteousnesse faith moses writing silas paul apostle moses writing good agreement doctrine gospell secondly righteousnesse faith hath witnesse law prophet thirdly moses knew preached gospell well law hence moses lawe doeth oftentimes signifie whole doctrine god psal tim moses accounted preacher thea doubt lawe set apostle christ preacher gospell iohn silas moses denomination hee part publish expound solution therefore law go pell destinguished nature doctrine bookes lawe people howbeit promise grace contayned writing also prophesied christ iohn moses wrote mee euen christ apostle preach law vrged repentance marke yet chiefest endeuor set forth promise grace therefore called minister grace dispencers gospell tim vse poynt silas serueth draw iewes sooner embracevse righteousnes faith since taught moses prophet whome much honoured respected yet refusing beleeue christ euen thought therby drawn away moses wheras paul tels matter would beleeue moses kept falling snare though bee sore often tempted mat6 tyranny exercised onely vppon ouer addicted wholly giuen disobedience ouer reprobate whome hee raigneth worketh euen pleasure thes thereason spirite sette ouer happen vnto saul resisted good spirite god therefore euill spirite sent rule vexe tim profit made hereof silas teach christian willingly obey god labouring keepe worde suffering according measure meaning god giuer ostentation contention mutuall edification tim part present exhortation silas two first exhortation selfe secondly explication certaine reason annexed giue edge exhortation exhortation hath preface matter preface pointeth paul apostolicall authority enabling command putteth romanes christian necessity yeeld obedience matter exhortation consists two precept
